intro: Macleania bullata, commonly known as the white-tipped mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Macleania bullata thrives in well-drained soils and full to partial sunlight, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens.
